identificationModule.briefTitle: Characterization of Retinal Microvascular and FAZ Changes in Ischemic Stroke and Its Different Types
identificationModule.officialTitle: Characterization of Retinal Microvascular and FAZ Changes in Ischemic Stroke and Its Different Types

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study aimed to access the microvascular changes in the superficial capillary plexus (SCP) and deep capillary plexus (DCP) in patients with ischemic stroke and its different types using optical coherence tomography angiography.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Investigators used OCTA to quantitatively access the retinal microvasculature of SCP and DCP, aiming to detect the geometry changes of retinal microvasculature and FAZ in ischemic stroke patients and its different types.

armGroups.label: Ischemic Stroke
armGroups.description: The diagnosis of ischemic stroke was obtained from previous diagnostic reports or electronic medical records, according to the diagnostic criteria from the Trial of Org 10172 in Acute Stroke Treatment (TOAST).

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria for healthy controls were no history of ischemic stroke or other neurological and ocular diseases.

interventions.name: Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography
interventions.description: Optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA) is a novel non-invasive, non-dye and high-resolution imaging technique, allowing real-time quantitative evaluation of retinal vasculature and the structure of foveal avascular zone (FAZ).

primaryOutcomes.description: The total length in millimeters of perfused retinal microvasculature per unit area in square millimeters in the annular region of analyzed area
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: A well-known parameter which indicates the degree of geometric complexity of vasculature
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: The direction of each vascular pixel to indicate the trend of the blood flow
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: The total numbers of pixels in the FAZ region
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: The ratio between the major and minor axes of the fitted ellipse from the FAZ boundary. The axis ratio of a perfect circular FAZ is equal to 1
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: The ratio of the perimeter of the FAZ to the parameter of a circle with equal area, reflecting the degree of roundness of the FAZ
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

primaryOutcomes.description: Similar to FC, but is less sensitive to irregular borders along the parameter of FAZ
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after meeting the inclusion and exclusion criteria

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patients who were diagnosed with ischemic stroke by MRI were scheduled for an OCTA examination. The diagnosis of ischemic stroke was obtained from previous diagnostic reports or electronic medical records, according to the diagnostic criteria from the Trial of Org 10172 in Acute Stroke Treatment (TOAST).

Exclusion Criteria:

1) Retinal diseases or diseases affecting vessel structure in fundus photography, including age-related maculopathy; diabetic retinopathy, central serous chorioretinopathy, retinal pigment epithelial detachment and glaucoma); poor cooperation in ophthalmic examinations; high refractive error (\>+6.00 D or \<-6.00 D Spherical Equivalent); low-quality OCTA images (signal strength index \< 6/10). Inclusion criteria for healthy controls were no history of ischemic stroke or other neurological and ocular diseases.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients who were diagnosed with ischemic stroke by MRI and healthy controls were scheduled for an OCTA examination.
